lines.gurmukhi: jYsy qau sirqw jlu kwstih n borq krq icq lwj ApnoeI pRiqpwirE hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Tau Saritaa Jalu Kaasatahi N Borata , Karat Chit Laaj Apanoee Pratipaariao Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as the water of streams and rivers does not sink the wood, it (water) has the shame of the fact that it has irrigated and brought the wood up;

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy qau krq suq Aink ieAwn pn qaU n jnnI Avgun aurDwirE hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Tau Karat Sout Anik Iaan Pana , Taoo N Jananee Avagoun Uradhaariao Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a son commits many mistakes but his mother who has given him birth never recounts them (she still keeps loving him).

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy qau srMn sUr pUrn prqigAw rwKY lK AprwD kIey mwir n ibfwirE hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Tau Sarann Soor Pooran Paratagiaa Raakhai , Lakh Aparaadh Keeay Maari N Bidaariao Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a culprit who may have myriad vices is not killed by a brave warrior in whose refuge he may have come, the warrior protects him and thus fulfils his virtuous traits.

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy hI prm gur pwrs prs giq isKn ko ikrq krmu kCU n bIcwirE hY ]536]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Hee Param Gur Paaras Paras Gati , Sikhan Ko Kirat Karamu Kachhoo N Beechaariao Hai ?536?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly the supreme benevolent True Guru does not dwell on any of the faults of His Sikhs. He is like touch of philosopher-stone (True Guru removes dross of the Sikhs in His refuge and makes them gold-like precious and pure).   (536)
